description: Romance book blog MVP - Modern Next.js site with book reviews and elegant design

userStories.title: Initialize Next.js project with TypeScript
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a modern web framework set up so I can build the blog efficiently.
acceptanceCriteria: Next.js 14+ project initialized with TypeScript
Tailwind CSS configured
Project structure created (components, app, lib folders)
ESLint and Prettier configured
Git repository initialized and connected to GitHub
Typecheck/lint passes

userStories.title: Create responsive layout with header and footer
userStories.description: As a user, I want a clean navigation experience across all pages.
acceptanceCriteria: Header component with site title 'Jacqueline's Book Blog' and navigation
Navigation links: Home, Reviews, About, Contact
Footer with social media links (Instagram, TikTok, Goodreads placeholders)
Mobile-responsive hamburger menu
Elegant typography (consider fonts like Playfair Display or Cormorant)
Typecheck/lint passes
Verify in browser using agent-browser skill

userStories.title: Design and implement homepage
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want an engaging homepage that showcases recent reviews.
acceptanceCriteria: Hero section with welcome message and site tagline
Featured book reviews section (3-4 recent posts)
Each review card shows: cover image, title, author, rating, excerpt
'View All Reviews' CTA button
About section preview with photo and short bio
Newsletter signup section
Typecheck/lint passes
Verify in browser using agent-browser skill

userStories.title: Create book review card component
userStories.description: As a user, I want consistent book review displays across the site.
acceptanceCriteria: Reusable BookReviewCard component
Props: coverImage, title, author, rating (5-star display), excerpt, postUrl
Hover effects (subtle shadow/scale)
Responsive grid layout
Rating displayed as stars (filled/half/empty)
Typecheck/lint passes
Verify in browser using agent-browser skill

userStories.title: Build book review page template
userStories.description: As a reader, I want to read full book reviews with all details.
acceptanceCriteria: Review page layout: cover image, title, author, rating
Full review text with proper typography
Metadata: genre, tropes, heat level, publication date
'Buy Now' links (Amazon, Bookshop.org placeholders)
Previous/Next review navigation
Share buttons (Twitter/X, Pinterest placeholders)
Typecheck/lint passes
Verify in browser using agent-browser skill

userStories.title: Create About page
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want to learn about Jacqueline and her reading preferences.
acceptanceCriteria: About page route
Hero section with profile photo placeholder
Bio text (placeholder copy about romance booktok creator)
'My Favorite Tropes' section
'Currently Reading' section
Social media links
Typecheck/lint passes
Verify in browser using agent-browser skill

userStories.title: Build Reviews listing page
userStories.description: As a user, I want to browse all book reviews.
acceptanceCriteria: Reviews page showing all reviews in grid
Sort options: Recent, Rating (high to low), Title (A-Z)
Filter by genre/trope (placeholder categories)
Pagination or infinite scroll
Search bar (basic filter by title/author)
Typecheck/lint passes
Verify in browser using agent-browser skill

userStories.title: Add sample content (seed data)
userStories.description: As a developer, I need sample book reviews to test the site.
acceptanceCriteria: Create 5-6 sample book review MDX files or JSON data
Include popular romance titles (e.g., 'The Love Hypothesis', 'Beach Read', 'People We Meet on Vacation')
Each has: cover URL, rating, full review text, metadata
Sample data loads on all pages correctly
Typecheck/lint passes

userStories.title: Implement color scheme and theming
userStories.description: As a user, I want a cohesive, romance-themed visual design.
acceptanceCriteria: Color palette: soft pinks, purples, or warm neutrals with good contrast
Custom Tailwind theme configured
Consistent button styles
Link hover states
Card shadows and spacing
Typography hierarchy (headings, body, captions)
Typecheck/lint passes
Verify in browser using agent-browser skill

userStories.title: Deploy to Vercel
userStories.description: As a developer, I need the site live and accessible.
acceptanceCriteria: Vercel project created and linked to GitHub repo
Automatic deployments on push to main
Custom domain configured (if available) or use Vercel subdomain
Environment variables set if needed
Build succeeds and site is live
Site loads correctly at production URL
userStories.notes: Deployment configuration complete: vercel.json created, README updated with deployment instructions. Actual deployment requires manual steps via Vercel Dashboard or CLI (standard workflow). Build verified successful in previous iterations.
